missing_semicolon.title: Missing Semicolon
missing_semicolon.explanation: Every Java statement must end with a semicolon. The compiler throws this when it encounters a missing one.

unclosed_string.title: Unclosed String Literal
unclosed_string.explanation: You forgot to close a string with a double quote.

illegal_start_of_expr.title: Illegal Start of Expression
illegal_start_of_expr.explanation: Occurs when a statement is misplaced or a keyword is used incorrectly.
illegal_start_of_expr.fix_example: Ensure proper syntax — e.g., method declarations must be inside a class.

cannot_find_symbol.title: Cannot Find Symbol
cannot_find_symbol.explanation: The compiler doesn't recognize a variable, method, or class — likely undeclared or misspelled.
cannot_find_symbol.fix_example: Check spelling and declaration: int count = 0; System.out.println(count);

class_name_mismatch.pattern: class .* is public, should be declared in a file named
class_name_mismatch.title: Class Name Mismatch
class_name_mismatch.explanation: The public class name must match the filename exactly.
class_name_mismatch.fix_example: Rename the file to match the class name or remove 'public'.

incompatible_types.title: Incompatible Types
incompatible_types.explanation: A variable assignment involves incompatible data types.
incompatible_types.fix_example: Use casting or change data type. Example: int x = (int) 5.5;

missing_return.title: Missing Return Statement
missing_return.explanation: A method declared with a non-void return type must return a value in all paths.
missing_return.fix_example: Add a return statement at the end of the method.

cannot_find_main.pattern: (NoSuchMethodError: main|Could not find or load main class)
cannot_find_main.title: Missing or Invalid Main Method
cannot_find_main.explanation: No valid entry point found. Java requires a 'public static void main(String[] args)' method.
cannot_find_main.fix_example: Add: public static void main(String[] args) { }

null_pointer.title: Null Pointer Exception
null_pointer.explanation: Attempted to use an object reference that is null.
null_pointer.fix_example: Check for null before using the object: if(obj != null) obj.method();

number_format.title: Number Format Exception
number_format.explanation: Attempted to convert a non-numeric string to a number.

arithmetic_exception.title: Arithmetic Exception (Divide by Zero)
arithmetic_exception.explanation: You attempted to divide by zero or an invalid arithmetic operation occurred.

stack_overflow.title: Stack Overflow Error
stack_overflow.explanation: Infinite recursion or deep method calls filled the call stack.
stack_overflow.fix_example: Ensure recursive calls have a valid base condition.

class_not_found.title: Class Not Found Exception
class_not_found.explanation: The JVM couldn't find a specified class in the classpath.
class_not_found.fix_example: Check import paths and ensure the required JARs are in the classpath.

illegal_argument.title: Illegal Argument Exception
illegal_argument.explanation: Method received an inappropriate or invalid argument.
illegal_argument.fix_example: Validate arguments before passing. Check method documentation for valid values.

illegal_state.title: Illegal State Exception
illegal_state.explanation: Method called at inappropriate time or object is in invalid state.
illegal_state.fix_example: Ensure object is in correct state before method call.

class_cast.title: Class Cast Exception
class_cast.explanation: Attempted to cast object to incompatible type.
class_cast.fix_example: Use instanceof before casting: if(obj instanceof String) { String s = (String)obj; }

concurrent_modification.title: Concurrent Modification Exception
concurrent_modification.explanation: Collection modified while iterating over it.
concurrent_modification.fix_example: Use Iterator.remove() or CopyOnWriteArrayList for concurrent modifications.

io_exception.title: IO Exception
io_exception.fix_example: Use try-catch or try-with-resources: try(FileReader fr = new FileReader(file)) { }

file_not_found.title: File Not Found Exception
file_not_found.explanation: File specified in path doesn't exist.
file_not_found.fix_example: Verify file path and existence: if(new File(path).exists()) { }

sql_exception.title: SQL Exception
sql_exception.fix_example: Check SQL syntax, connection, and handle exceptions properly.

no_such_element.title: No Such Element Exception
no_such_element.explanation: Attempted to access element that doesn't exist (Iterator, Scanner, etc).
no_such_element.fix_example: Check hasNext() before next(): if(scanner.hasNext()) scanner.next();

unsupported_operation.title: Unsupported Operation Exception
unsupported_operation.explanation: Operation is not supported by this implementation.
unsupported_operation.fix_example: Use mutable collection or different data structure.

out_of_memory.title: Out of Memory Error
out_of_memory.explanation: JVM ran out of heap memory.
out_of_memory.fix_example: Increase heap size: java -Xmx512m, or optimize memory usage.

negative_array_size.title: Negative Array Size Exception
negative_array_size.explanation: Attempted to create array with negative size.
negative_array_size.fix_example: Ensure array size is positive: int[] arr = new int[Math.max(0, size)];

string_index_out_of_bounds.title: String Index Out of Bounds
string_index_out_of_bounds.explanation: Accessing string character at invalid index.
string_index_out_of_bounds.fix_example: Check string length: if(i < str.length()) char c = str.charAt(i);

interrupted_exception.title: Interrupted Exception
interrupted_exception.explanation: Thread was interrupted while waiting, sleeping, or occupied.

deadlock.title: Deadlock Detected
deadlock.explanation: Two or more threads are blocked forever, waiting for each other.
deadlock.fix_example: Acquire locks in consistent order, use timeout mechanisms.

assertion_error.title: Assertion Error
assertion_error.fix_example: Review assertion condition or disable assertions: java -da

generic_error.title: Generic Error
generic_error.fix_example: Check stack trace for specific error type and cause.

method_not_found.title: No Such Method Error
method_not_found.explanation: Method exists at compile time but not at runtime (version mismatch).
method_not_found.fix_example: Ensure correct library versions, rebuild project.

clone_not_supported.title: Clone Not Supported Exception
clone_not_supported.fix_example: Implement Cloneable: class MyClass implements Cloneable { }

parse_exception.title: Parse Exception
parse_exception.explanation: Error parsing string to date or other format.
parse_exception.fix_example: Use correct format pattern: SimpleDateFormat sdf = new SimpleDateFormat("yyyy-MM-dd");

malformed_url.title: Malformed URL Exception
malformed_url.explanation: URL string is invalid or malformed.

socket_exception.title: Socket Exception
socket_exception.fix_example: Check network connectivity and socket configuration.

bind_exception.title: Bind Exception
bind_exception.explanation: Port already in use or cannot bind to address.
bind_exception.fix_example: Use different port or close existing connection on that port.

connect_exception.title: Connect Exception
connect_exception.fix_example: Verify server is running and firewall settings.

variable_shadowing.title: Variable Shadowing
variable_shadowing.explanation: Local variable hides instance variable with same name.
variable_shadowing.fix_example: Use 'this.variableName' to refer to instance variable.

resource_leak.title: Resource Leak
resource_leak.explanation: Streams or files were opened but not closed.
resource_leak.fix_example: Use try-with-resources: try(FileInputStream f = new FileInputStream('file.txt')) { }

wrong_equals_usage.title: Wrong equals() vs == Usage
wrong_equals_usage.explanation: In Java, '==' compares references while equals() compares content.

infinite_loop.title: Infinite Loop
infinite_loop.fix_example: Ensure the loop variable changes inside the loop.

naming_conventions.title: Naming Conventions
naming_conventions.explanation: Use camelCase for variables/methods, PascalCase for classes, and UPPER_CASE for constants.
naming_conventions.fix_example: Example: int totalMarks; class StudentDetails; final int MAX=100;

exception_handling_best.title: Exception Handling Best Practice
exception_handling_best.explanation: Catch specific exceptions instead of generic Exception to improve clarity.
exception_handling_best.fix_example: Use multiple catch blocks or custom exceptions.

code_readability.title: Code Readability
code_readability.explanation: Use indentation and meaningful names to improve readability.
code_readability.fix_example: Always indent properly and document complex logic with comments.

learn_java_websites.title: Online Learning Resources
learn_java_websites.explanation: Here are some reliable websites to learn Java:

web_component.title: Deploying Chatbot as Web Component
web_component.explanation: To deploy your chatbot as a web component, wrap it using HTML/JS and connect the Python backend via Flask or FastAPI.
web_component.fix_example:
Frontend: Create chatbot.js using custom HTML element.
Backend: Deploy Flask app on Render/Heroku and use fetch() to send/receive messages.
